title: aeplots
text: vignette documents use functions aeplots create tables plots analysing adverse event data clinical trials.
code: library(aeplots)

title: aeplots
text: generate tables plots summarise adverse events clinical trials, R package requires input dataset data frame format. sample dataset two treatment arms shown : need convert body_system_class severity columns factors. Note functions , need specify column names corresponding variable needed unless rename column names dataset default column names specified sample dataset documentation. refer detailed documentation function typing:
code: data(df2) head(df2, 10) df2$aebodsys <- as.factor(df2$aebodsys) # for severity to be presented in ascending order, we order the levels df2$severity <- ordered(df2$severity, c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe")) help(aetable)

title: aeplots
text: functions aetable, aeseverity, aestacked aebar can take 4 treatment arms. sample dataset 3 treatment arms:
code: data(df3) head(df3, 10) df3$aebodsys <- as.factor(df3$aebodsys) df3$severity <- ordered(df2$severity, c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe"))

title: aeplots
text: aetable plots table AE summary body system class arm. contains total number participants risk per arm (\(N_{1}\), \(N_{2}\)), frequency (N), proportion (%), total number events (n), incidence rate (IR), number adverse events per participant (mean & SD) treatment effect estimate 95% confidence interval (CI). include additional covariates besides arm model, specify vector variable names variables argument.  can specify model used estimate treatment effect 95% CI via model argument. available model options Poisson (rate), Poisson (count), Negative Binomial (rate), Negative Binomial (count), Binomial (logit), Binomial (log) Binomial (identity).  can specify number decimal places proportions, IR, mean SD columns well number significant figures treatment effect estimate 95% CI.  can choose drop treatment effect estimate 95% CI specifying treatment_effect_estimate=FALSE.  can also choose drop mean column specifying mean=FALSE.
code: aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"), treatment_effect_estimate=TRUE, variables = c("variable1", "variable2")) aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"), treatment_effect_estimate=TRUE, model="Binomial (logit)", variables = c("variable1", "variable2")) aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"), treatment_effect_estimate=TRUE, variables = c("variable1", "variable2"), proportions_dp=2, IR_dp=2, mean_dp=2, SD_dp=2, estimate_sf=4, CI_sf=4) aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"), treatment_effect_estimate=FALSE) aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"), treatment_effect_estimate=FALSE, mean=FALSE)

title: aeplots
text: aetable include treatment effect estimates 95% CIs datasets 2 treatment arms. change labels control interventions table, specify label control argument control_name specify intervention labels argument intervention_names. Note intervention_names specified using order interventions specified intervention_levels.
code: aetable(df3, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", control_name="No Drug", intervention_levels=c("Intervention 1", "Intervention 2"), intervention_names=c("Drug A", "Drug B"))

title: aeplots
text: aeseverity plots table frequencies proportions events severity categories. specify number decimal places proportions via argument proportions_dp.  can choose drop number events column specifying n_events=FALSE.
code: aeseverity(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention", "Placebo"), body_system_class="aebodsys", proportions_dp=2) aeseverity(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention", "Placebo"), body_system_class="aebodsys", n_events=FALSE)

title: aeplots
code: aeseverity(df3, arm_levels=c("Intervention 1", "Intervention 2", "Placebo"), arm_names=c("Drug A", "Drug B", "No Drug"), body_system_class="aebodsys", n_events=FALSE)

title: aeplots
text: aedot plots dot plot proportions alongside treatment effect estimates accompanying 95% confidence interval visualise AE harm profiles two-arm randomised controlled trials.  Similar aetable, can specify model used estimate treatment effect 95% CI via model argument. available model options unadjusted (RR), unadjusted (RD), Poisson (rate), Poisson (count), Negative Binomial (rate), Negative Binomial (count), Binomial (logit), Binomial (log) Binomial (identity).
code: aedot(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention="Intervention") aedot(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention="Intervention", model="unadjusted (RD)")

title: aeplots
text: aestacked plots stacked bar chart proportions body system class arm maximum severity. severity ordered, required specify levels severity ascending order argument severity_levels.  can change colour severity specifying vector colour codes corresponding severity level severity_colours argument.
code: aestacked(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", arm_levels=c("Intervention","Placebo"), severity_levels=c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe")) aestacked(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", arm_levels=c("Intervention","Placebo"), severity_levels=c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe"), severity_colours=c("#D0EE11", "#48B5C4", "#115F9A"))

title: aeplots
code: aestacked(df3, body_system_class="aebodsys", arm_levels=c("Intervention 1","Intervention 2", "Placebo"), arm_names=c("Drug A","Drug B", "No Drug"), severity_levels=c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe"))

title: aeplots
text: aebar plots bar chart number events reported per participant.  can change colour representing treatment arm specifying vector colour codes arm_colours argument according order arm levels specified arm_levels argument.
code: aebar(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention","Placebo"), facets=FALSE) aebar(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention","Placebo"), arm_colours=c("#FFB55A", "#B2E061"), facets=FALSE)

title: aeplots
text: can plot bar chart treatment arm separate facets specifying facets=TRUE.
code: aebar(df3, arm_levels=c("Intervention 1","Intervention 2", "Placebo"), arm_names=c("Drug A","Drug B", "No Drug"), facets=FALSE) aebar(df3, arm_levels=c("Intervention 1","Intervention 2", "Placebo"), arm_names=c("Drug A","Drug B", "No Drug"), facets=TRUE)

title: aeplots
text: can save tables docx specifying filepath save_docx_path argument.
code: aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"), treatment_effect_estimate=TRUE, variables = c("variable1", "variable2"), save_docx_path="table.docx")

title: aeplots
text: can save tables plots images specifying filepath save_image_path argument.
code: aebar(df3, arm_levels=c("Intervention 1","Intervention 2", "Placebo"), arm_names=c("Drug A","Drug B", "No Drug"), facets=TRUE, save_image_path="image.png") #> Saving 8 x 6 in image

title: Authors and Citation
text: Xiao Xuan Tan. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tan X (2023). aeplots: Create Tables Plots Analysing Adverse Event Data Clinical Trials. R package version 0.1.0, https://txx4986.github.io/aeplots/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {aeplots: Create Tables and Plots for Analysing Adverse Event Data in Clinical Trials},   author = {Xiao Xuan Tan},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://txx4986.github.io/aeplots/}, }

what: Create Tables and Plots for Analysing Adverse Event Data in Clinical Trials
title: Create Tables and Plots for Analysing Adverse Event Data in Clinical Trials
text: R package create tables plots analysing adverse event data clinical trials

title: Create Tables and Plots for Analysing Adverse Event Data in Clinical Trials
text: can install aeplots : Please refer devtools documentation instructions set working development environment install devtools depending platform.
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("https://github.com/txx4986/aeplots.git")

title: Create Tables and Plots for Analysing Adverse Event Data in Clinical Trials
text: Functions available package: aetable: Plots table AE summary body system class aeseverity: Plots table AE summary severity body system class aedot: Plots dot plot proportions alongside treatment effect estimates accompanying 95% confidence interval give overview harm profile aestacked: Plots stacked bar chart present proportions participants event arm maximum severity aebar: Plots bar chart present number events reported per participant see detailed documentation function:
code: help(aetable) ?aetable

what: Bar chart for number of events reported per participant — aebar
title: Bar chart for number of events reported per participant — aebar
text: Bar chart number events reported per participant

title: Bar chart for number of events reported per participant — aebar
code: aebar(   data,   arm_levels,   id = "id",   arm = "arm",   arm_names = NULL,   arm_colours = NULL,   facets = TRUE,   save_image_path = NULL )

title: Bar chart for number of events reported per participant — aebar
text: data data frame adverse_event, id arm columns arm_levels vector factor levels arm variable id name id column arm name arm column arm_names vector names arm arm variable arm_colours vector colours arm facets logical value whether plot bar chart facets save_image_path file path save bar chart image

title: Bar chart for number of events reported per participant — aebar
text: Bar chart presenting number events reported per participant

title: Bar chart for number of events reported per participant — aebar
code: aebar(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention","Placebo"), facets=FALSE)

what: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
text: aedot creates plot summarises AE harm profiles via following visualisations: left panel: percentage participants event treatment group central panel: relative risk/ risk difference/ incidence rate ratio/ odds ratio observing event treatment group compared control group, along 95% confidence interval right panel: data table containing number participants least one event number events treatment group

title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
code: aedot(   data,   control,   intervention,   body_system_class = "body_system_class",   id = "id",   arm = "arm",   date_rand = "date_rand",   last_visit = "last_visit",   model = "unadjusted (RR)",   variables = c(),   save_image_path = NULL )

title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
text: data data frame adverse_event, body_system_class, id arm columns control factor level control arm intervention factor level intervention arm body_system_class name body_system_class column id name id column arm name arm column date_rand name date_rand column last_visit name last_visit column model unadjusted relative risk/risk difference model used computation treatment effect estimate 95% CI variables vector variable names included model computation treatment effect estimate (excluding arm) save_image_path file path save dot plot image

title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
text: dot plot proportions alongside treatment effect estimates accompanying 95% confidence interval

title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
text: treatment effect 95% confidence interval estimated via following models : unadjusted (RR): unadjusted relative risk unadjusted (RD): unadjusted risk difference Poisson (rate): fitting generalised linear model Poisson family log link length follow time offset Poisson (count): fitting generalised linear model Poisson family log link count response Negative Binomial (rate): fitting Negative Binomial model length follow time offset Negative Binomial (count): fitting Negative Binomial model count response Binomial (logit): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family logit link Binomial (log): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family log link Binomial (identity): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family identity link default model unadjusted (RR) model. Poisson Negative Binomial models, treatment effect estimate Incidence Rate Ratio (IRR). Binomial (logit) model, treatment effect estimate Odds Ratio (). Binomial (log) model, treatment effect estimate Relative Risk (RR). Binomial (identity) model, treatment effect estimate Risk Difference (RD). Additional covariates besides arm can added model via argument variables. Note interaction terms added model.

title: Dot plot to visualise AE and harm profiles in two-arm randomised controlled trials — aedot
code: df2$aebodsys <- as.factor(df2$aebodsys) aedot(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention="Intervention") #> Bin width defaults to 1/30 of the range of the data. Pick better value with #> `binwidth`.

what: Table of frequencies and proportions of events by severity categories — aeseverity
title: Table of frequencies and proportions of events by severity categories — aeseverity
text: aeseverity used plot table AE summary severity level body system class arm using following summary statistics: N: Frequency (number participants least one event severity level body system class) %: Proportions (number participants least one event severity level body system class relative number participants risk) n: Number adverse events severity level body system class Note aeseverity can take 5 severity levels severity variable.

title: Table of frequencies and proportions of events by severity categories — aeseverity
code: aeseverity(   data,   arm_levels,   severity_levels = NULL,   body_system_class = "body_system_class",   severity = "severity",   id = "id",   arm = "arm",   n_events = TRUE,   arm_names = NULL,   severity_names = NULL,   proportions_dp = 1,   save_image_path = NULL,   save_docx_path = NULL )

title: Table of frequencies and proportions of events by severity categories — aeseverity
text: data data frame adverse event, severity, id arm columns arm_levels vector factor levels arm variable severity_levels vector severity levels ascending order severity ordered factor body_system_class name body_system_class column severity name severity column id name id column arm name arm column n_events logical value whether include number events body system class severity arm_names vector names arm arm variable severity_names vector names severity severity variable proportions_dp number decimal places proportions save_image_path file path save table image save_docx_path file path save table docx

title: Table of frequencies and proportions of events by severity categories — aeseverity
text: flextable frequencies proportions events severity categories

title: Table of frequencies and proportions of events by severity categories — aeseverity
code: df2$aebodsys <- as.factor(df2$aebodsys) df2$severity <- ordered(df2$severity, c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe")) aeseverity(df2, arm_levels=c("Intervention","Placebo"), body_system_class="aebodsys", proportions_dp=2)

what: Stacked bar chart of proportions for each body system class by arm and maximum severity — aestacked
title: Stacked bar chart of proportions for each body system class by arm and maximum severity — aestacked
text: Stacked bar chart proportions body system class arm maximum severity

title: Stacked bar chart of proportions for each body system class by arm and maximum severity — aestacked
code: aestacked(   data,   arm_levels,   body_system_class = "body_system_class",   severity = "severity",   id = "id",   arm = "arm",   arm_names = NULL,   severity_levels = NULL,   severity_colours = NULL,   save_image_path = NULL )

title: Stacked bar chart of proportions for each body system class by arm and maximum severity — aestacked
text: data data frame adverse_event, body_system_class, severity, id arm columns arm_levels vector factor levels arm variable body_system_class name body_system_class column severity name severity column id name id column arm name arm column arm_names vector names arm arm variable severity_levels vector level severity ascending order severity ordered factor severity_colours vector colours level severity ascending order save_image_path file path save stacked bar chart plot image

title: Stacked bar chart of proportions for each body system class by arm and maximum severity — aestacked
text: stacked bar chart presenting proportions participants event arm maximum severity

title: Stacked bar chart of proportions for each body system class by arm and maximum severity — aestacked
code: df2$aebodsys <- as.factor(df2$aebodsys) df2$severity <- ordered(df2$severity, c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe")) aestacked(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", arm_levels=c("Intervention","Placebo"), severity_levels=c("Mild", "Moderate", "Severe"))

what: Table of AE summary by body system class — aetable
title: Table of AE summary by body system class — aetable
text: aetable used plot table AE summary body system class arm using following summary statistics: Total number participants risk per arm Frequency (number participants least one event body system class) Proportions (number participants least one event body system class relative number participants risk) Number adverse events per participant: presented counts, mean (SD) Total number events incidence rates (number events relative total time follow-) Treatment effect estimate 95% confidence intervals

title: Table of AE summary by body system class — aetable
code: aetable(   data,   control,   intervention_levels,   body_system_class = "body_system_class",   id = "id",   arm = "arm",   date_rand = "date_rand",   last_visit = "last_visit",   control_name = NULL,   intervention_names = NULL,   treatment_effect_estimate = TRUE,   model = "Poisson (rate)",   variables = c(),   mean = TRUE,   proportions_dp = 1,   IR_dp = 1,   mean_dp = 1,   SD_dp = 1,   estimate_sf = 3,   CI_sf = 3,   save_image_path = NULL,   save_docx_path = NULL )

title: Table of AE summary by body system class — aetable
text: data data frame adverse_event, body_system_class, id, arm, date_rand last_visit columns control factor level control arm intervention_levels vector factor levels interventions body_system_class name body_system_class column id name id column arm name arm column date_rand name date_rand column last_visit name last_visit column control_name name control arm intervention_names vector names interventions treatment_effect_estimate logical value whether include treatment effect estimate 95% CI column summary table (2 arms) model model used computation treatment effect estimate 95% CI variables vector variable names included model computation treatment effect estimate (excluding arm) mean logical value whether include mean SD column summary table proportions_dp number decimal places proportions IR_dp number decimal places incidence rate mean_dp number decimal places mean number AEs per participant SD_dp number decimal places standard deviation number AEs per participant estimate_sf number significant figures treatment effect estimate CI_sf number significant figures 95% CI save_image_path file path save table image save_docx_path file path save table docx

title: Table of AE summary by body system class — aetable
text: flextable AE summary body system class arm

title: Table of AE summary by body system class — aetable
text: treatment effect 95% confidence interval estimated via following models : Poisson (rate): fitting generalised linear model Poisson family log link length follow time offset Poisson (count): fitting generalised linear model Poisson family log link count response Negative Binomial (rate): fitting Negative Binomial model length follow time offset Negative Binomial (count): fitting Negative Binomial model count response Binomial (logit): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family logit link Binomial (log): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family log link Binomial (identity): fitting generalised linear model Binomial family identity link default model Poisson (rate) model. Poisson Negative Binomial models, treatment effect estimate Incidence Rate Ratio (IRR). Binomial (logit) model, treatment effect estimate Odds Ratio (). Binomial (log) model, treatment effect estimate Risk Ratio (RR). Binomial (identity) model, treatment effect estimate Risk Difference (RD). Additional covariates besides arm can added model via argument variables. Note interaction terms added model.

title: Table of AE summary by body system class — aetable
code: df2$aebodsys <- as.factor(df2$aebodsys) aetable(df2, body_system_class="aebodsys", control="Placebo", intervention_levels=c("Intervention"), treatment_effect_estimate=TRUE, variables = c("variable1", "variable2"))
